result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnson J Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 10:03a.m.
State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears via Zoom video with Attorney Michael Hughes in person.

Waiver of Prelim. COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for trial.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed. 
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

PLEA to:
COUNT 1: Sex Registry Violation >> NO CONTEST.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation, concurrent to current supervision; CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling/programming deemed appropriate by agent; comply with sex offender registration; DNA sample and surcharge; and CC. 18 days jail credit. Defense has 10 days to get jail credit amended.

Case Called: 9:17 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence in person; Agent Christina Borneman; Defendant appears from MCJ, pro se.

Agent makes statement re: treatment, notes Defendan't can not get consultation and assessments for treatment with a cash bond, and a bed might not be available for a few weeks.
ADA Lawrence objects to a signature bond.
COURT addresses parties.
COURT makes findings.
COURT grants motion; amends bond to a signature bond $1,000.00. Same conditions.

Court finds defendant indigent;
